bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 11, 1924

div1.p: Read states that a suspected case of malaria on board a steamship was confirmed by blood examination. She sends Carter copies of correspondence received from Deeks related to the case.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 11, 1924
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
-----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
-----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
January 11, 1924
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
With reference to the case of fatal malaria
on board the steamship “Saramacca” proceeding from
Puerto Barrios, concerning which we wrote you under
date of December 19, 1923, you may be interested to
know that the diagnosis of malaria was confirmed by
blood examination. Copies of later correspondence enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3; enc.4 are
enclosed.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FMR:EP E
